Yes, it is very concerning how the media can handle child actors, and it's essential that there are measures in place to protect them. In some countries, there are laws in place that restrict how the media may cover minors. For instance, some countries require parental permission before the media can publish images of children.

Moreover, parents, agents, and other professionals in the industry must prioritize the child's safety and well-being over their career. It's critical to have open communication with child actors to ensure they are comfortable with the work they're taking on and to monitor their emotional and mental health. 

In conclusion, while the media's treatment of child actors can be troubling, there are measures in place to prevent it. It's essential to continue to advocate for child actors' rights and well-being to ensure that they aren't exploited or harmed by the media.
